alert.note: Alert for Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 2:57PM CDT until July 13 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Cimarron River near Ripley affecting Payne County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cimarron River near Ripley. * WHEN...Until Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, places along the Cimarron River valley in Payne County are briefly flooded. Agricultural lands and oil wells located near the channel are isolated by water in cutoff channels along the river valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 16.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The Cimarron River is expected to rise to a crest of 17.0 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM CDT.
